channel.title: La Tinaja
channel.description: My name is Brian Jones. These are my notes on topics including books, publishing, tech, and history.

item.title: Weekly Reading: April 5, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes material on bots, gamer girls, and purgatory.

item.title: brianjon.es
item.description: My experiment with a personal biography site

item.title: The Browser as Command Line
item.description: Who is the audience for browser-based tools and services on mobile devices?

item.title: Weekly Reading: March 22, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes light comic sci-fi fantasy, commandments for a digital age, and Tex-Mex.

item.title: Weekly Reading: March 15, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes an overview of medieval European fishery and an analysis of the medium of comics..

item.title: Weekly Reading: March 1, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes an environmental history of Narragansett Bay and Peter Thiel’s notes on building a startup.

item.title: Weekly Reading: February 22, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes material on the economics of soccer, open sourcing history research, and identify users for online services.

item.title: Review: Lauren Benton, A Search For Sovereignty: Law and Geography in European Empires, 1400-1900
item.description: Lauren Benton’s work provides important new tools for relating the development of colonial and international legal regimes to geography and to the application of spatial thinking to understanding historical processes.

item.title: Weekly Reading: February 15, 2015
item.description: This week’s reading includes material on the built environment, the tech industry, and the Hispanic roots of the United States.

item.title: Weekly Reading: February 8, 2015
item.description: Books and essays I read this week include material on online media and imperial history.
